channel.title: CVE Feed for SECOM -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for SECOM -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-7732|2024-08-16T17:30:08.971Z -- secom -- dr.id%20attendance%20system
item.description: Dr.ID Access Control System from SECOM does not properly validate a specific page parameter, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to inject SQL commands to read, modify, and delete database contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-7731|2024-08-14T06:30:58.938Z -- secom -- dr.id%20access%20control%20%20system
item.description: Dr.ID Access Control System from SECOM does not properly validate a specific page parameter, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to inject SQL commands to read, modify, and delete database contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-7732|2024-08-14T06:55:59.726Z -- secom -- dr.id%20attendance%20system
item.description: Dr.ID Access Control System from SECOM does not properly validate a specific page parameter, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to inject SQL commands to read, modify, and delete database contents.

item.title: CVE-2024-6046|2024-06-17T03:33:19.048Z -- secom -- wrtr-304gn-304tw-upsc
item.description: SECOM WRTR-304GN-304TW-UPSC V02(unsupported-when-assigned) does not properly filter user input in the specific functionality. Unauthenticated remote attackers can exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary system commands on the device.
